typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Event can't start before applications close."

arguments.value: Event can't start before applications close.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Event can't start before applications close."

nodes.documentation:
A modifier signifiying that a certain method can only be used by the creator
 of the contract.
 Rollbacks the transaction on failure.
nodes.name: onlyOwner

arguments.value: Not a designated master node.

nodes.documentation:
A modifier signifiying that rewards can be set only by the designated master node.
 Rollbacks the transaction on failure.
nodes.name: onlyCurrentMaster

nodes.documentation:
A modifier signifying that a certain method can only be used by a wallet
	marked as a participant.
	Rollbacks the transaction or failure.
nodes.name: onlyParticipating

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Not possible in current event state."

arguments.value: Not possible in current event state.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Not possible in current event state."

nodes.name: onlyState

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Not enough users joined for required minimum votes."

arguments.value: Not enough users joined for required minimum votes.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Not enough users joined for required minimum votes."

nodes.documentation:
A modifier taking care of all the timed state transitions.
 Should always be used before all other modifiers, especially `onlyState`,
 since it can change state.
 Should probably be used in ALL non-constant (transaction) methods of
 the contract.
nodes.name: timedStateTransition

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Event state can't be modified anymore."

arguments.value: Event state can't be modified anymore.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Event state can't be modified anymore."

arguments.value: Not a valid sender address.
Not validating rewards.
Validation round mismatch.
Already voted for this round.

nodes.documentation:
Ensure we can receive money at any time.
 Not used, but we might want to extend the reward fund while event is running.

arguments.value: You are already participating.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "You can only join in the Application state."

arguments.value: You can only join in the Application state.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "You can only join in the Application state."

arguments.value: Not enough tokens staked.

nodes.documentation:
Apply for participation in this event.
 Available only during the Application state.
 A transaction to this function has to be done by the users themselves,
 registering their wallet address as a participent.
 The transaction does not have to include any funds.
nodes.name: joinEvent
isParticipating

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Not possible in this validation state."

arguments.value: Not possible in this validation state.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Not possible in this validation state."

nodes.name: setRewards

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Not possible in this validation state."

arguments.value: Not possible in this validation state.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Not possible in this validation state."

nodes.documentation: Triggered by the master node once rewards are set and ready to validate
nodes.name: markRewardsSet

nodes.documentation: Called by event resolver nodes if they agree with rewards
nodes.name: approveRewards

nodes.documentation: Called by event resolvers if they don't agree with rewards
nodes.name: rejectRewards

nodes.documentation: Checks current approvals for threshold
nodes.name: checkApprovalRatio

nodes.documentation: Checks current rejections for threshold
nodes.name: checkRejectionRatio

arguments.value: Consensus can't be reached

nodes.documentation: Handle the rejection of current rewards
nodes.name: rejectCurrentValidation

nodes.documentation: Ratio of nodes that approved of current hash
nodes.name: approvalRatio

nodes.documentation: Ratio of nodes that rejected the current hash
nodes.name: rejectionRatio

nodes.documentation: Returns the whole array of event resolvers.
nodes.name: getEventResolvers

nodes.documentation: Checks if the address is current master node.
nodes.name: isMasterNode

nodes.documentation:
Returns the calling user's assigned rewards. Can be 0.
 Only available to participating users in the Reward state, since rewards
 are not assigned before that.
nodes.name: getReward

nodes.documentation: Returns all the addresses that have rewards set.
nodes.name: getRewardsIndex

nodes.documentation:
Returns rewards for specified addresses.
 [[ethRewards, tokenRewards], [ethRewards, tokenRewards], ...]
nodes.name: getRewards

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "You do not have any rewards to claim."

arguments.value: You do not have any rewards to claim.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "You do not have any rewards to claim."

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Critical error: not enough balance to pay out reward. Contact Verity."

arguments.value: Critical error: not enough balance to pay out reward. Contact Verity.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Critical error: not enough balance to pay out reward. Contact Verity."

nodes.documentation:
Claim a reward.
 Needs to be called by the users themselves.
 Only available in the Reward state, after rewards have been received from
 the validation nodes.
nodes.name: claimReward

nodes.documentation:
Returns an array of consensus rules.
 [minTotalVotes, minConsensusVotes, minConsensusRatio, minParticipantRatio, maxParticipants]
nodes.name: getConsensusRules

nodes.documentation: Advances the event's state to the next one. Only for internal use.
nodes.name: advanceState

nodes.documentation: Sets consensus rules. For internal use only.
nodes.name: setConsensusRules
